intro: Astragalus aschuturi, commonly known as the Persian milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are typically dispersed by wind. Astragalus aschuturi is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitats.
